article.title: Zero energy mode for a spin-1/2 charge particle in a two-dimensional magnetic field with the constant asymptotics

multiple_choice_question.text: This formula represents the Hamiltonian for which model in the long wavelength approximation?  Η = (σαρα + σypy)
In this two-component spinor representation, what do ΨΑ and ΨB represent? Ψ = (ΨΑ,ΨΒ)Τ
choices: Energy eigenvalues for different spin states
Envelope functions associated with probability amplitudes on sublattices A and B
Components of the magnetic field vector

multiple_choice_question.text: This equation defines the asymptotic behavior of which physical quantity? B(r → ∞) = Bo
This substitution is used to eliminate which variable from the equations (11) and (12)?  ΨΑ,Β = fA, ΒΕγλ
